title: Covestro
text:
Covestro AG is a German company which produces a variety of <a href="polyurethane">polyurethane</a> and <a href="polycarbonate">polycarbonate</a> based raw materials. Products include isocyanates and polyols for cellular foams, <a href="thermoplastic%20polyurethanes">thermoplastic polyurethane</a> and polycarbonate pellets, as well as polyurethane based additives used in the formulation of coatings and adhesives. It is a <a href="Bayer">Bayer</a> spin off formed in the fall of 2015 and was formerly called Bayer MaterialScience, Bayer's <a href="materials%20science">materials science</a> division.
Covestro shares were first offered on the <a href="Frankfurt%20Stock%20Exchange">Frankfurt Stock Exchange</a> in October 2015. Bayer sold its entire remaining stake in May 2018, Bayer's pension fund had a 6.8% stake managed separately.
The main industries served are <a href="automotive%20manufacturing">automotive manufacturing</a> and supply, electrical engineering and electronics, <a href="construction">construction</a> and home products, and sports and leisure. Their products include <a href="coating">coating</a>s and <a href="adhesives">adhesives</a>, <a href="polyurethanes">polyurethanes</a> that are used in <a href="thermal%20insulation">thermal insulation</a>, electrical housings, and as a component of <a href="footwear">footwear</a> and <a href="mattress">mattress</a>es, and <a href="polycarbonates">polycarbonates</a> such as Covestro's <a href="Makrolon">Makrolon</a>, which are highly impact-resistant plastics. Covestro polyurethane was used in the 2014 official <a href="FIFA%20World%20Cup">FIFA World Cup</a> football. Before 2019, Covestro enjoyed rapid earnings growth following supply shortages of chemicals used in foams.
Financials.
In 2015, the company netted USD revenues of $13.46B, net income of $382M and an operating margin of 5.1%. In 2018, the company's revenues were $16.29B, net income of $2B, and operating margin of 15.5%.
In Q1 of 2019, a drop in revenue and net income was seen, with revenues down at $3.54B compared to 2018's Q1 of $4.21B, a 16% drop. Q2 2019 revenues also saw a 16.9% drop from Q2 2018's $4.3B to $3.58B. Likewise with Net income, Q2 2019 also dropped from Q2 2018's $672M to $210M.
Among the 3 key segments of the company, Polyurethanes (PUs), Polycarbonates (PCs), and Coatings/Adhesives/Specialties, Polyurethanes experienced 70.5% drop in EBITDA Q2 2019 compared to Q2 2018 due to needing to drop prices from increased supply and competition. Revenues dropped from $2.19B to $1.66B in Q2 2019 as a result. The next biggest drop in key segments was Polycarbonates from revenues $1.18B to $1B Q2 2019 over past year. The price drop of PUs and PCs were -26.8% and -18.8% respectively. According to the report, demand drop of the auto industry led to a drop in volumes for PCs while construction and electronics industries grew.
